text.content: AD 1: Quality Volume
Headline:
Quality Problems Hide as Volume
PI ATTORNEYS: You don't have a lead volume problem.

You have a lead quality problem disguised as volume.

Your vendor sends 100 MVA leads. Your intake qualifies 15. You sign 5. You blame intake for the 85 that didn't qualify.

But those 85 were never going to sign. They weren't real injury cases. They weren't high intent. They were clicks, not clients.

Here's the real solution: Stop receiving leads. Start receiving signed cases.

We fund the marketing. We generate the demand. Our PI-trained intake team qualifies prospects and closes retainers on your behalf.

~$2,000 average cost per signed case. No retainers. No setup fees. No ad spend required.

Quality isn't just upstream. It's delivery.

PROMPT: Near-black (#1A1A1A) background with subtle data visualization texture. TOP: "QUALITY PROBLEMS HIDE AS VOLUME" in bold white header. CENTER: Funnel overflowing with garbage/junk labeled "UNQUALIFIED LEADS". RIGHT: Red X callouts "Blame intake", "Buy more leads", "Hire trainers". Red "ELIMINATED" stamp. BOTTOM: Blue process flow "REAL INJURY ‚Üí WE QUALIFY ‚Üí SIGNED CASE ‚Üí ~$2K PER CASE". Tagline: "Stop sorting junk. Start receiving cases." Industrial tech aesthetic. DO NOT INCLUDE: rounded corners, warm colors, photos, emojis.
AD 2: Intake Defense
Headline:
Your Intake Team Isn't the Problem
PI ATTORNEYS: Stop blaming your intake team.

They're not dropping the ball. They were handed garbage.

When 85% of your "leads" are unqualified from the start‚Äîwrong injury type, no treatment, liability issues, already retained‚Äîno amount of training fixes that.

Your intake team isn't a filter for junk. They're supposed to close real cases.

Here's how to actually fix it: We pre-qualify every prospect before you ever see them. Verified injury. Confirmed liability. Insurance checked. Quality scored.

Your team stops sorting and starts closing.

~$2,000 average cost per signed case. No retainers. No setup fees. No ad spend required.

Stop blaming downstream for upstream problems.

PROMPT: Near-black (#1A1A1A) background. TOP: "YOUR INTAKE ISN'T THE PROBLEM" with crossed-out funnel icon. CENTER: Intake workers at desks being buried by avalanche of "JUNK LEADS" / "BAD LEADS" / "GARBAGE" papers. Callout: "They were handed garbage". Red "BAD LEADS" stamp. BOTTOM: Blue process flow "QUALIFIED DEMAND ‚Üí PI-TRAINED TEAM ‚Üí SIGNED RETAINER ‚Üí ~$2K PER CASE". Tagline: "Stop blaming downstream for upstream problems." DO NOT INCLUDE: rounded corners, warm colors, photos, emojis.
AD 3: Speed Myth
Headline:
Speed Won't Fix Bad Leads
PI ATTORNEYS: Speed-to-lead won't save you.

You can call in 30 seconds. You can have the best intake script. You can follow up seven times. None of it matters if the lead wasn't a real injury case to begin with.

Most PI firms try to solve conversion problems at intake. They hire trainers. They buy dialers. They run reports.

But they're optimizing the wrong part of the funnel.

Here's the actual fix: stop receiving leads entirely.

We fund the marketing. We generate the demand. Our PI-trained intake team qualifies prospects and closes retainers on your behalf. You receive signed cases‚Äînot contacts to chase.

~$2,000 average cost per signed case. No retainers. No setup fees. No ad spend required.

Stop optimizing intake. Start receiving signed cases.

PROMPT: Near-black (#1A1A1A) background. TOP: "SPEED WON'T FIX BAD LEADS" with crossed-out speedometer in red. CENTER: Funnel filled with mechanical debris/junk labeled "UNQUALIFIED LEADS". White callouts with red X: "Faster dialer", "Better scripts", "More follow-ups". Red "ELIMINATED" stamp across funnel. BOTTOM: Blue arrow flow "HIGH-INTENT DEMAND ‚Üí WE CLOSE THE CASE ‚Üí SIGNED RETAINER DELIVERED ‚Üí ~$2K PER CASE". Tagline: "Stop fixing the funnel. Remove it entirely." DO NOT INCLUDE: rounded corners, warm colors, photos, emojis.
AD 4: Vendor Secret
Headline:
The Dirty Secret About "Exclusive" Leads
PI ATTORNEYS: Your "exclusive" leads aren't exclusive.

Most lead vendors don't generate leads. They aggregate them. They buy from the same sources as everyone else, then resell to multiple firms in your market.

That "exclusive" lead you just paid $300 for? Three other attorneys got the same one.

You're not competing on intake speed. You're competing against vendors who sold you the same prospect.

Here's actual exclusivity: We run one campaign per market. One firm. Your cases aren't shared, resold, or recycled. The demand we generate is yours.

~$2,000 average cost per signed case. No retainers. No setup fees. No ad spend required.

Real exclusivity. Not vendor marketing speak.

PROMPT: Near-black (#1A1A1A) background. TOP: "THE VENDOR DIRTY SECRET" in bold white. CENTER: Split comparison. LEFT (red tint, "SHARED LEADS"): Single lead source splitting to multiple firm icons, labeled "Multiple firms = 1 lead", red X. RIGHT (green/blue tint, "EXCLUSIVE LEADS"): Single lead source to single firm icon with checkmark, labeled "One firm = one lead". BOTTOM: Blue glowing box "1 CAMPAIGN = 1 FIRM". Tagline: "Real exclusivity. Not vendor speak." DO NOT INCLUDE: rounded corners, warm colors, photos, emojis.
